Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Erwinia herbicola (IC50=25 µg/ml), Escherichia coli (IC50<2.5 µg/ml), Pseudomonas putida (IC50<2.5 µg/ml), Pseudomonas syringae (IC50<2.5 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (IC50=65 µg/ml), Serratia sp. (IC50<2.5 µg/ml).Fungi:Candida albicans (IC50=5 µg/ml), Cryptococcus neoformans (IC50<2.5 µg/ml), Saccharomyces cerevisiae (IC50=3 µg/ml), Aspergillus flavus (IC50=60 µg/ml), Fusarium culmorum (IC50=68 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Circular dichroism (CD) spectra of shepherin II showes that shepherin II in 50% trifluoroethanol has 75% random coils, without any alpha-helices.
Sequence Information.Function: These antimicrobial peptides exhibit antimicrobial activity against Gram-negative bacteria and fungi.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed in roots but not in leaves and stems.

Literature.Title: Characterization and cDNA cloning of two glycine- and histidine-rich antimicrobial peptides from the roots of shepherd's purse, Capsella bursa-pastoris.
Literature.Author: Park CJ, Park CB, Hong SS, Lee HS, Lee SY, Kim SC.

Literature.Title: Characterization and cDNA cloning of two glycine- and histidine-rich antimicrobial peptides from the roots of shepherd
